definitions.definition: (a piece of) strong, thick string made of long twisted threads:
examples: A sailor threw a rope ashore and we tied the boat to a post.

definitions.definition: several of one type of object connected together on a string:
thick rope which surrounds an area used for boxing (= sport in which two people hit each other) or wrestling:
examples: The middleweight boxing champion had his opponent up against the ropes.

definitions.definition: to tie things together with rope:
examples: I'll rope my horse to your car and pull you out of the ditch.
